subclusters.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
Neuroendocrine and Brain Nutrient Sensing CR Theories
Gene Expression and Epigenetic Regulation CR Theories
Hormesis and Stress Response CR Theories

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR-induced metabolic shifts, especially brain metabolism switching from glucose to ketone bodies and mitochondrial preservation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes metabolic adaptation including reduced metabolic rate and oxidative damage reduction under CR.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details lifelong CR-induced hepatic fat metabolism reprogramming involving lipolysis, ketogenesis, and FGF21 regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes CR-induced metabolic shift toward increased protein turnover and reduced macromolecular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolic shift and gene expression changes reducing macromolecular damage and stress response.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR-induced release of aerobic metabolism repression in yeast, increasing respiration and reducing ROS.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR-induced hypometabolic state, reduced mitochondrial proton leak, and decreased ROS production.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Energy Substrate Shift CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains CR effects on yeast aging via metabolic and biochemical changes linked to quiescence and differentiation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine and Brain Nutrient Sensing CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR effects on brain nutrient sensing pathways (AMPK, mTOR, Sirt1), neurogenesis, and systemic aging regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine and Brain Nutrient Sensing CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR preservation of somatotropic axis via protection of GHRH receptor binding sites, affecting GH/IGF-1 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine and Brain Nutrient Sensing CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CR modulation of hypothalamic hunger and circadian signaling pathways integrating hormonal and behavioral longevity effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine and Brain Nutrient Sensing CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR regulation of circadian clock gene expression via BMAL1-dependent and independent mechanisms optimizing metabolism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine and Brain Nutrient Sensing CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR protection of neural stem cells from age-related decline via anti-inflammatory and anti-senescence effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Gene Expression and Epigenetic Regulation CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR modulation of genome-wide gene expression changes with aging, slowing transcriptional aging signatures.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Gene Expression and Epigenetic Regulation CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CR effects on gene expression related to stress response, mitochondrial biogenesis, circadian regulation, and longevity pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Gene Expression and Epigenetic Regulation CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR-induced epigenetic modifications including DNA methylation changes that modulate aging-related gene regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Gene Expression and Epigenetic Regulation CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DR effects on conserved nutrient-responsive pathways and genotype-dependent variability in aging modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Gene Expression and Epigenetic Regulation CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR modulation of nutrient and energy sensing pathways (mTOR, Sirt1, AMPK, IIS) affecting metabolism and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Stress Response CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR-induced hormesis involving metabolic shifts, sirtuin activation, and reduction of glycation damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Stress Response CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormetic stress response induced by moderate CR enhancing antioxidant defenses and reducing oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Stress Response CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CR-induced hormesis enhancing protein quality control, autophagy, and anti-inflammatory glucocorticoid effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Stress Response CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR delaying immune senescence by maintaining youthful immune cell phenotypes via altered maturation and turnover.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Stress Response CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on food restriction slowing primary aging processes and delaying physiological decline and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Stress Response CR Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes dietary restriction extending lifespan via generalized mechanisms independent of specific disease pathways.
